channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Towards a new generation of human-inspired language models
item.description: Can a computer learn a language the way a child does? A recent study sheds new light on this question. The researchers advocate for a fundamental revi...

item.title: Follow the water: Searching for a lunar oasis
item.description: As humankind imagines living off-planet -- on the moon, Mars and beyond -- the question of how to sustain life revolves around the physical necessitie...

item.title: New clues to the mechanism behind food tolerance and allergies
item.description: Study reveals how immune cells in the gut distinguish between food and harmful pathogens, shedding light on the origins of both food allergies and int...

item.title: Ocean-surface warming four times faster now than late-1980s
item.description: The study helps explain why 2023 and early 2024 saw unprecedented ocean temperatures.

item.title: A super-Earth laboratory for searching life elsewhere in the Universe
item.description: Thirty years after the discovery of the first exoplanet, we detected more than 7000 of them in our Galaxy. But there are still billions more to be dis...
